abstract.p: A method for distributing and reliably redeeming electronic cash value vouchers that uses existing POS terminals. The vouchers may be distributed via mobile telephones. The voucher comprises an alphanumeric code which is entered into the standards compliant POS terminal. The system checks that the voucher is valid and provides a redemption value to the POS which can be credited by the retailer. The transaction can then be completed by the retailer using known methods.

A method for distributing and reliably redeeming electronic cash value vouchers that uses existing POS terminals. The vouchers may be distributed via mobile telephones. The voucher comprises an alphanumeric code which is entered into the standards compliant POS terminal. The system checks that the voucher is valid and provides a redemption value to the POS which can be credited by the retailer. The transaction can then be completed by the retailer using known methods.

nplcit.text: LEIGH PHILLIPS: "i-movo launches mobile voucher marketing system", DMEUROPE.COM, [Online] 20 September 2005 (2005-09-20), XP002433611, Retrieved from the Internet: URL:http://www.dmeurope.com/default.asp?ArticleID=10303> [retrieved on 2007-05-09]

ANONYMOUS: "The trouble with vouchers", MARKETING WEEK, [Online] no. 51013, 13 October 2005 (2005-10-13), XP002433612, Retrieved from the Internet: URL:http://www.i-movo.com/Marketing_Week_13-10.pdf> [retrieved on 2007-05-09]

abstract.p: A method for distributing and reliably redeeming electronic cash value vouchers that uses existing POS terminals. The vouchers may be distributed via mobile telephones. The voucher comprises an alphanumeric code which is entered into the standards compliant POS terminal. The system checks that the voucher is valid and provides a redemption value to the POS which can be credited by the retailer. The transaction can then be completed by the retailer using known methods.

Electronic cash value vouchers are described which can be used at existing pointer sales (POS) terminals made up of a credit card like code (16 digit alphanumeric code) which includes an identifier code (4 digits) which identifies the issuer of the voucher and a voucher code which relates to the value of the voucher. The voucher code can be provided to the use of SMS to a mobile telephone. The voucher can then be used together with the issue a code carried on a card (magnetic or chip) at a pointer sales terminal. The issuer and voucher codes are concatenated and forwarded to an acquirer for further processing. In an alternative embodiment the issuer code and voucher code are received by the user as a single combined code.

nplcit.text: IT Backbones, "i-movo Unveils World s First Secure Mobile Marketing System Using Electronic Payment Networks" [online], 2002, i-movo.vom. Available from: http://www.i-movo.com/First_Secure_Mobile_Marketing_System.htm [Accessed 26 June 2006]

abstract.p: A method of redeeming an electronic voucher using a standards compliant top up or EFTPOS terminal. A cash value voucher comprising an alphanumeric string and a cash value is sent to a mobile phone and to redeem the voucher the alphanumeric string is entered at the top up terminal. The voucher is then validated by the terminal, depending on the parameters specified by the host system. Normally these will be: <SL> <LI>1. Is the Voucher Number valid? Y/N <LI>2. Has the Voucher Number been used before/does it have any "balance of uses" left against it? Y/N </SL> If validated both parameters will have a Y parameter and the voucher then represents a cash value.

nplcit.text: IT Backbones, "i-movo Unveils World s First Secure Mobile Marketing System Using Electronic Payment Networks" [online], 2002, i-movo.vom. Available from: http://www.i-movo.com/First_Secure_Mobile_Marketing_System.htm [Accessed 26 June 2006]

abstract.p: A method for authorising the redemption of cash value vouchers using an ISO/EEC 7812-1 and/or ANSI X4.13 compliant POS terminal is disclosed. A cash value voucher comprising an alphanumeric number and having a cash value is provided, which cash value is not related to the number. The number is entered at an ISO/EEC 7812-1 and/or ANSI X4.13 compliant POS terminal. The POS terminal forms a concatenated string comprising the number

POS terminal identifier and an issuer identification number. The string is sent to an acquirer and the acquirer after validating the string sends the string to the issuer. The issuer authenticates the voucher number and amends the string such that the string now comprises the cash value, POS terminal identifier and an issuer identification number, which enables authorisation for the value of the cash value. The amended string is transmitted via the acquirer to the POS terminal to authorise the redemption of the voucher for the cash value.

nplcit.text: LEIGH PHILLIPS: "i-movo launches mobile voucher marketing system" DMEUROPE.COM, [Online] 20 September 2005 (2005-09-20), XP002433611 Retrieved from the Internet: URL:http://www.dmeurope.com/default.asp?ArticleID=10303> [retrieved on 2007-05-09]

abstract.p: A method for distributing and reliably redeeming electronic cash value vouchers that uses existing POS terminals. The vouchers may be distributed via mobile telephones. The voucher comprises an alphanumeric code which is entered into the standards compliant POS terminal. The system checks that the voucher is valid and provides a redemption value to the POS which can be credited by the retailer. The transaction can then be completed by the retailer using known methods.

Procédé de distribution et de remboursement sûr de bons de caisse électroniques, utilisant des terminaux de point de vente existants. Les bons peuvent être distribués par le biais de téléphones portables. Chaque bon comprend un code alphanumérique qui est saisi dans le terminal de point de vente réglementaire. Un système vérifie la validité du bon et transmet au terminal de point de vente une valeur de remboursement dont un commerçant peut créditer un client. Le commerçant peut ensuite achever la transaction au moyen de procédés connus.
